p.s: >my name is Faraj al-Byarshan, I am 41 years old and I came to New York in year 2005.
My home country is the Iraq where I lived 25 years.
During this time I got a wife.
We have two sons.
First they couldn't come with me to New York because we had not enough money.
But two years later a friend of us took them with him.
In these two years I was really sad angry about myself.
I shouldn't have gone to New York without my family I said to myself every day.
But I had no choice to do anything else.
In our country we had bad living conditions.
My parents died there because they had no money to buy food for themselfsthemselves.
As I said before we hadn't much money as well.
It was only enough to get me to New York.
We thought that I can get a job there and earn some money so I can send something to my family.
But it wasn't that easy.
I asked restaurants, supermarkets and everything else.
But no one wanted an immigrant who works for them.
I couldn't communicate with my family from 2005 to 2007.
So I didn't know, if they are still alive or dead or maybe on the way to New York as well.
I was hoping that they are alive so I tried to get a job for two weeks.
After this time I finally got one at a cleaning company.
Every month I earned 200$.
I took 100 for myself and sent 100 to my family.
I wasn't shuresure if they get it but I believed in God.
That's the only thing you can do in this situation.
In 2007 when my family finally came to New York I was the happiest man on earth.
My wife told me that they came in here with a little fishing boat.
They drove over the whole Atlantic with a fishing boat!
You can't imagine how scared you are at this time.
But they are alive and they are with me.
That's the only thing that counts.
